Reviews.Title: Easy Entry-Level Camera
Reviews.Author: amazonaddict
Reviews.Content: This camera is incredibly easy to use, but offers enough advanced features for the average point-and-shoot user.  I bought the camera for my older parents who needed a simple camera.  I was choosing between the Kodak M1033 and this camera, but decided to go with this camera because it is slightly easier to use.  Kodak describes the C series as a line of easy entry-level cameras, and that's definitely true.PROS:- Easy for first-time digital camera users- Large LCD screen- Large amount of megapixels- Many "scene" settings pre-programmed for different types of shots- Very low price- Compact size- Plug and play sharing via EasyShareCONS:- No viewfinder- M1033 has a couple extra features (i.e., panoramic stitching)- Uses AA batteries vs. charger (although this is mitigated by a good set of rechargeable batteriesBuy this camera if you're looking for an affordable, compact, easy to use camera.  It will meet the needs of most point-and-shoot users.  Do not buy this camera if you're looking to customize your shots beyond pre-programmed settings (i.e., adjustments in ISO, f-stop, shutter speed, etc.), but that should be self-evident, as this is a point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: Tremendous Bargain
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Roberts "TRUMAN"
Reviews.Content: I am currently retired from graphic design and photostyling for catalogs, I found the C180 to be a camera I wish I'd had ten years ago. I was amazed to find it has so many settings (it has ISO as well as many other settings for the most fun and practicality.) It also takes videos.I took it on vacation with me and made some pretty special videos as well as stills. I recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality photos
Reviews.Author: SF Gina "Gina"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes poor quality photos. Yes, it's slim and lightweight. Yes, the shutter speed is snappy. But the photos are of such poor quality that it's a pretty useless camera.I bought this camera at Best Buy for $100 because my Olympus SP-320 is starting to act up (sometimes it won't turn on). During the first two days I owned the Kodak, I took nearly 100 photos in a variety of lighting conditions; none of them were keepers. A few looked okay when viewed on the computer at 25% size, but most were noticeably fuzzy. When viewed at 100%, all 97 photos are fuzzy; some of them even look like paintings rather than photos. Most of the photos had awful contrast, too.As a last test before returning the camera, I took the Kodak and my Olympus outside and two a set of identical photos with each (a park with lots of trees on a sunny day). The photos from the 7 megapixel Olympus were sharp even in the shadowed areas and the sky was a beautiful blue. The photos from the Kodak were noticeably fuzzy and the sky was nearly white. I took the Kodak back.

Reviews.Title: decent for video
Reviews.Author: Andrew Titus
Reviews.Content: One thing, is that with a 2 gig chip you can get about 45 min of video. we've stopped using our dedicated camera for video and use this camera, although the quality is not as good. We don't have to buy the video tapes anymore....

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: V. Presutti
Reviews.Content: i gave this to my granddaughter for her 12th birthday. without reading any instructions she ran outside to use it. in a few minutes she was back with two videos of her friend doing cartwheels. this is one user friendly inexpensive digcam.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad little camera.
Reviews.Author: William Brennan "wreckingball34"
Reviews.Content: I like the new c180 camera from Kodak. I needed a new point and shoot, and for the money, this one does the job fine. Love the 10 MP quality images. The only con I can think of is that the auto focus is a bit slow (almost nonexistent in low light situations). I'm not going to complain too loudly though. The price was right.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Mohammed F. Al-amri
Reviews.Content: I've bought this camera recently and I love it. I have only two gripes, it uses AA batteries vs. charger and you have to use SD cards, as internal storage is pathetic.The camera shoots excellent images and does what it is supposed to do excellently. Video is also good.Overall I'm satisfied with my purchase and would recommend it for anyone looking for an inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Read all instructions first!
Reviews.Author: David Yost "Almost Firewood"
Reviews.Content: I dropped by Easyshare DX7440 so I had to get something real quick while I get the other repaired.  The features were not quite the same, but if you read the instructions first instead of thinking you know what you're doing, you will find this to be a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice general purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Caitlin Oconnor "student of the world"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for those of us who are not very technologically inclined.  I gave the Easyshare as a Valentine's Day gift for my fiance.  He (and I!) has had a lot of fun taking pictures using the different settings, which is my favorite part of the camera.  For example, "up close" is for extreme close ups without blurriness, "sport" for fast movement capture and "backlight" for backlit pictures.  The night settings are great, like "extreme low light", "night landscape", and "night portrait".  It even has individual settings for capturing fireworks, sunsets, sunny beaches and flowers.... interesting.Truth be told I've never owned a digital camera before, so I'm sure there are better quality cameras out there. But for our general use needs and for the price it's great. Its a decent size overall and the picture display is easy to see.The EasyShare software is simple to use to edit pics as well as make cards and other picture items.  I haven't tried the "share" function yet for uploading to youtube, but I'll try it when I've taken some video clips on the camera.Overall the Kodak EasyShare is a good general use camera with a nice amount of bells and whistles.  Its a great value for the price.::UPDATE::If you buy this camera, get rechargeable batteries, because the camera sucks the power dry within an hour or so of use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its price
Reviews.Author: Carl Albarran
Reviews.Content: First of all, i got this camera for much cheaper than it is listed. so right there, i was already happy.  here are the pros and cons of this little cameraPros:1.  easy to use.  great for teens, elderly, and those who are not tech savvy2.  great features. this ties into the ease of use coz everything u need is already programmed.  close up shots, far away shots, moving shots....etc3.  battery.  it takes double A batteries, which i love, i hated it when my camera's built in rechargeable battery dies and there is no way around it but to plug it in.4.  size.  it's so small and light weight, u can put it in ur pocket.  the screen is big compared to its size5.  quality.  the quality of pics and vids is good given the fact that this is s low end camera.  there is also zoom, though only a 3 optical zoom6.  face detection.7.  in camera memory. though u can only take a few shots with the internal memory but it comes in handy if ur SD card is suddenly fullcons:1.  battery life.  it sucks battery life like none other.  so u have to carry extra double A's2.  no viewfinder.  only the screen to see where to take ur shots. so in full daylight, u are SOL3.  no speaker.  after taking a vid, u want to play back? yes, u can, but with no sound4.  zoom.  it's only 3 optical zoom. not quite enough for my liking.  we like to race cars on a road course, so i need to zoom in to get the good shots.  but good enough for regular picture takingi have not used every single feature on this camera, so i am not going into details about them. i also have not use the USB yet, so i dont know if it works great, though i have read bad reviews about that.so my pros are more than the cons, so i'd recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Hutchinson
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month and so far I really like it.  It's nice, simple to use, and takes good pictures, which is the most important thing.  I only wish the camera was a little thinner and had a bigger screen, but you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Battery Glutton!
Reviews.Author: P. D. Lueken
Reviews.Content: This camera is cute, has ample features and takes really good pictures, but the batteries get eaten way too quickly. I took 10 pictures and a 10 second video and the batteries registered half used. So, I tried fully charged rechargeables and the same thing. Then, I tried a different brand of alkaline batteries, just went through the camera to adjust my preferences and the batteries were already showing at about a quarter used - I hadn't even taken a picture!The reason I purchased it in the first place was to take it with me on my trip to see my 18 month old grandson. It would be easy to transport and easy to tuck away in a pocket, keeping little hands off it. I have a Nikon SLR that I love, but it's not as practical for the at-the-moment shots and much larger to pack away. Had the Kodak had a different battery system, it would have been a keeper.So, I purchased the Fujifilm Finepix Z30. Same price range, but more features, smaller in size, takes beautiful pictures and has a rechargeable battery. Also, video playback has sound when played back on the camera - not so on the Kodak.I know there are tons of little cameras out there, and if you don't mind changing out batteries every time you use it, then this Kodak is for you. If you prefer a lithium rechargeable battery, I would recommend the Fuji.

Reviews.Title: "It's my baby"
Reviews.Author: rebecca taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a week ago, and i fell in love with it right  from the start! It has so many cool features such as the scn button with  options like taking pictures of flowers, landscape, beach, firecrakers, and much more. This camera doubles into a video camra too, you have to import the video to your computer before you can receive sound to your video. This camera is easy to import your pics to your computer, and is compatable with both Mac and PC's. I am twelve  and i absoulutely love the Kodak Easyshare C180! This camera is definately worth the money! I hoped I helped!

Reviews.Title: Constant problems with it
Reviews.Author: Klaus M. Maolepszy
Reviews.Content: I've gone through 2 of them and both had serious problems.The 1st one lost a color channel and quit taking usable pictures while on a vacation in Europe. Luckily I had a spare camera. Even while it was working many, many times it would NOT TURN ON when I pressed the power button. Other times it would simply stop functioning while taking pictures. Once I got back from that vacation, I replaced it with an identical unit.Now the replacement has the same power problems - it freezes in the middle of taking pictures and at times simply does not turn on.If this camera would simply function properly, I'd give it a decent rating. It's features are ok and it's fairly portable - which is what I wanted from this.I'm taking the 2nd one back and demanding a refund this time and would advise all to avoid this one.KMM

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Sasebo Meg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I really wanted a small, portable one that I could just grab and go with or throw in a bag or stick in my pocket.  I have a larger Z740 Kodak that I love, but it's too big, especially if I am traveling.The C180 was at a great price ($69.99) and is super easy--like most Kodak cameras are to use.  Since I was already familiar with the controls, I had absolutely no problems using it straight from the box. Even if you are new to Kodak, the controls are easy to learn.  Battery life is O.K. if you use batteries that are specifically for digital cameras and electronics.  The batteries that came with the camera did not last very long at all--less than a week. (I am currently using Duracell Powerpix and they have lasted a very long time)I highly recommend this camera or any Kodak since they are so user friendly.  I had bought my parents a similar one for Christmas 2008 and they have no problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jkaputs
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I was looking for when I was shopping for a camera for my 80 year-old mother. The camera is simple to use and does not require any extensive,digital pre-knowledge to operate.  The LCD display is big enough (although bigger is always better for oldsters) to view easily, and the shutter button is large enough to operate even with lightweight gloves on.The camera has plenty of adjustable parameters for more advanced users, but does a great job simply leaving it at default settings.  The major drawback to this unit is the lack of a viewfinder.  A viewfinder is the traditional method of picture-taking for a large number of people and does away with the glare issue that plagues LCD displays in bright light.Overall, a very good purchase considering the price.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned After 5 Months
Reviews.Author: Jan Groovy "Jan Groovy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this due to a lot of stellar reviews on here.  People raved how easy it was and the only draw back seemed to be the battery life. And yes, the battery life is absolutely TERRIBLE, not even allowing me 4 hours of use before flaking out, powering down and NOT allowing me to turn the camera back on (we are talking BRAND SPANKING NEW BATTERIES here!).  But even worse than THAT, I just bought this camera in February and just this past week, my camera has COMPLETELY malfunctioned; I can not use it at all (I did not drop it or misuse it).  I wouldn't waste my money on this camera again.  Yeah, the photos are decent and the share factor is kinda cool, but the negative FAR outweight the positive on this product.  Buyer beware!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner camera but needs rechargable battery!
Reviews.Author: W. Applegren "mom of 2"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 10 year old daughter.  She loves it.  So much that she went through the batteries the first day.  She is disappointed in the short battery life, we both wish we'd gotten one with a rechargable battery, because she keeps turning it off and on which just kills the battery life.But the camera itself has been great. Easy to use, takes great pictures, hasn't broken yet!  I guess I just need to buy her a big Costco pack of AA batteries for her birthday and let her run through them!

Reviews.Title: worst camera ever!
Reviews.Author: ASG "angryshortguy"
Reviews.Content: The usb connection wont fit properly into camera to transfer photos.just terrible!I purchased a Kodak Mini Charger an 2 AA Ni-MH batteries but they won't power the unit. It doesn't work!!!Their own rechargeable batteries don't work with their camera.How insane is that?I'm returning this when I get back from vacation.At the rate this thing is eating through batteries, I'm out another $30 in AA batteries plus the cost of the charger and Ni-MH batteries.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed...
Reviews.Author: Jordan Sollitto
Reviews.Content: I regret not paying more attention to the other customer reviews prior to buying this camera.  Although it takes perfectly good pictures, it has two very major drawbacks (both of which I would have been warned about had I been more thorough).  First, it has no viewfinder through which to frame your photo -- the only image you have to work with is the one that appears on the LED screen.  The problem there is that in anything even remotely resembling full sunlight the LED screen is virtually unseeable.  So you are literally shooting blind much of the time.  Second, it doesn't have a rechargable battery...and the battery life isn't very long.  So you need to always carry a spare set of batteries around....just in case.  In short, I wish I'd spent a little more and bought a better camera.

Reviews.Title: For the money, worth it
Reviews.Author: MRS. KNIGHTent "IM SO EXTRAORDINARY"
Reviews.Content: Besides not being able to hear sound when you play back a video, nor lasting long with batteries (what camera does), everything else about this camera surpassed my expectations. It was afforable beyond measure, and works like a charm. I would buy it again if I needed to. Also, I love the color! ^_^

Reviews.Title: Camera's o.k.; software is glitchy
Reviews.Author: Kate Smith
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our 15 year old daughter to use on a frequent basis. The quality of the photos is better than we expected for the price and size of the camera, but the software has been problematic. We've had to download several patches and - thanks to yet another glitch - had 400 photos our daughter took in Italy last week erased from the SD card (the "Delete when finished copying" box was very carefully and deliberately NOT checked). Thank goodness for recovery software (NOT part of the Kodak package)!

Reviews.Title: Kodak is easy to use
Reviews.Author: Carl A. Camenisch "Liteworker"
Reviews.Content: Just bought this for my 9 year old daughter due to color Red, her favorite, and reported ease of use.  Well besides that it take really GREAT pictures. Very nice LCD display as well, but no viewfinder so a bit hard to use in bright sunlight. This is not a toy like her earlier camera.  Only downside is that it really burns batteries so you must get rechargeables AA.  Would be nice if it had accepted the lithium CR-V3 or RCR-V3 like my Kodak Z1285.  Overall very good value at the refurbished price of about $50.

Reviews.Title: lasted only 4 months
Reviews.Author: cari77 "cari77"
Reviews.Content: Mine only lasted 4 months.  while it worked, I was happy with it - especially since I paid only $50 for it at Staples when it was on sale and I used coupons to bring the price down even more .  But I certainly expected to get at least a year's worth out of it.  I bought it March 23rd and yesterday, July 26th, the batteries were dead, so I put brand new batteries in it.  turned it on, took a couple of pics....  in under a minute it blinked low battery, turned off, wouldnt turn back on. replaced the batts again - same thing.  and again. and again.  I tried 3 different brands/types of batteries.  The camera was not dropped, gotten wet , or anything out of the ordinary.  I'm very upset :(

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Teri Walchsabo
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical as I had seen some negative responses.  I took it on a cruise and the pictures are good (not great), it was easy to carry, easy to use and the batteries lasted longer than expected.

Reviews.Title: Easyshare isn't just a name
Reviews.Author: M. M. Wooddell Jr.
Reviews.Content: Both the camera and software are easy to navigate and use. My grandaughter needed a camera that she could use and for sharing pictures on Facebook. She loves the camera and really likes the teal color.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Ian Eppard
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera for the price and it takes good pictures. The problem is, the thing only turns on when it wants to. I could just put new batteries in and it just won't turn on. Then eventually it will turn on, but by then i've already missed a lot of great pictures. You can get much better cameras for even cheaper than this thing. It's really no good.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Awful
Reviews.Author: S. Streck "Manga Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital camera that I could call my own. My older brother was kind enough to buy me a camera at all so I looked for one that was fairly low in price and still seemed to be good quality. When I received it it seemed to work just fine. I was disappointed that it did NOT have a rechargeable battery. After about ten minutes playing with it, it quit working. I've had this camera almost a year now and haven't had much trouble with batteries after I bought the rechargeable ones but there are other problems. The camera will freeze, randomly, and won't turn on, nor off. Some times the camera won't turn on even if I press the power button. The picture quality is okay I suppose but I have not other cameras to compare it to.Pros:-Cheap-Fairly Good Quality PicturesCons:-Craptastic Battery Life-Many Problems With the Power Buttons-Even when video is taken, you can't listen to the audio. You have to copy it to your computer first.-Pictures/Video's don't always copy, no matter what you do. I had to delete my entire band concert off my camera because it wouldn't copy. I was very, very angry.

Reviews.Title: Didnt last a year
Reviews.Author: Chrissy
Reviews.Content: I have had kodak easy share cameras before this that worked awesome!!!  The only reason I decided to get a new camera is because my cable had gotten destroyed and the camera I had was getting older so I decided to get a newer one with better resolution.  I got this camera as a Christmas gift and when I first got it it worked well. pictures maybe not as good quality as the original camera.  I got this camera in December and by July it stopped working.  It would turn on but, when I went to snap photos it just froze.  This was my third digital camera and by far the worst one I have had.

Reviews.Title: worth the money
Reviews.Author: Kevin L. Stibrany "collector"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for almost a year. It's really easy to use. It takes great pictures, and the software is very user friendly. If you buy it, also invest in some good, long life, rechargeable batteries. If you use cheap batteries, it will use them up in a matter of minutes. I would recommend this camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: hipshooter
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a year now and I really like it. It is prefect for taking with me anywhere.. small enough for my boyfriend to put in his pocket if i don't have or want to carry my purse.The picture quality is good enough to have some nice prints... obviously you won't get professional quality.But for a small, cheap, carry around camera it's really great!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera to carry around
Reviews.Author: believeume
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. The picture quality is outstanding. I bought it for my wife for her birthday, and now she carrys it with her where ever she goes....I highly recommend this camera for anyone looking for a simple camera to use, that takes great pictures....

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: TNnurse01
Reviews.Content: What a great camera for the price! Pictures look great, so easy to use. Definitely a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Not Very Durable
Reviews.Author: Connor Opie "the photographer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a local retailer for around $20 on clearance. It was a perfect companion to my larger Kodak Z8612IS because of it's smaller size. It also took nice pictures. It does eat batteries fairly quickly if you turn it on and off a lot or use the flash frequently, so invest in rechargeable batteries. Zoom is acceptable for a point and shoot, but it doesn't zoom very far. I loved this camera when it was working; the lcd screen was broken on a recent fishing trip when it was squished inside my camera bag which was stuck underneath a car seat being folded forward. The LCD screen is cracked and completely unusable, which makes the camera basically unusable. I'm disappointed that it broke so easily. Be careful with this camera and you'll have a nice camera for a low price.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, Nice features
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera. I purchased it after owning a different Kodak Easy Share Camera for several years.  It is a lot smaller than the old camera which is nice and the screen on the back is a lot larger which is great!! I love the fact that it's very easy to change the camera setting to adapt for the type of picture that you will be taking.  All you have to do is turn the dial and "poof" you're set for taking action pictures, or videos, or whatever you select! There are only two issues that I have with this camera... The battery life does not last!! I even purchased the more expensive "ultra advanced batteries" and it didn't seem to make a difference.  The other issue is that when you record a video, and you play it back on the camera, there is no sound.  The sound IS there when you upload to a computer, but not on the camera itself.  All in all, I'd give this camera a "thumbs up."

Reviews.Title: NICE
Reviews.Author: S.A. "photo nut"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the price. It's small enough (thin) to carry along and tuck in all sorts of small places.  Easy to download the Kodak Easy Share Software. Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyDShare C180 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy A. Oliva "Cindy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to take around with you and fit into your purse and always ready to use. Just need to make sure you have enough battery power before using it for a long use. Easy and functional for those nice simple memories you want to have. Also easy to put onto your computer.

Reviews.Title: Esther
Reviews.Author: E. Weiss
Reviews.Content: This camera was very easy for my daughter to learn how to use. The only thing which we were very disappointed with is the fact that you can't hear the video clips that you take with it. The quality of the pictures is pretty good for a camera of this price and especially for my daughter who's all of 11 years old! I would buy it again for another child!

Reviews.Title: lil' Red camera
Reviews.Author: Randall
Reviews.Content: This is a usually from kadak, if you ever had a kodak its simple, runs on batteries and does everything you need/want it too. This model is sllinder than others I have seen and owned(3rd kodak) and kodaks are as always cheap!! that is why I buy them but I rate it under because it runs on batteries(I got rechargables for it you need them it drains batteries quickly) and at first it is semi-complacated to use but easy if you take the time to figure it out. It is a nice sleek look in red and  is not too bulky

Reviews.Title: Kodak Dependability
Reviews.Author: A. DeFalco
Reviews.Content: I must admit I am reviewing this camera based on someone elses opinion and a similar kodak model, I've had for 4 years.  I bought this camera as a gift for my mom and she loves it.  I bought her this kodak because I own one of its predessors the 643.  My 643 has worked great, no problems takes great pictures, and runs on 2 AA batteries just like this one.  The design is only minor differences but kodaks are easy to work with good on the pocket book and are dependable.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share
Reviews.Author: Tantegloryglo "music lover"
Reviews.Content: I liked the ease of use and the fact that it's very light weight. This is important to me when traveling. I didn't like the fact that the manufacturer did not include a detailed instruction book with the camera but instead it had to be looked up on line.

Reviews.Title: Takes some time to figure out what mode to use for lighting
Reviews.Author: MHL "MHL"
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty good overall. The batteries that came with it died after taking just a few pictures. We put new, name-brand batteries in so hopefully we won't see the same results, if so that really sucks. It is pretty intuitive to use, we didn't have to read the directions. I think it's going to take a while to figure out exactly what setting to use for each situation. I took a bunch of pictures of fireworks on New-Years without realizing there was a "Fireworks" mode. Overall it's a pretty good camera, nice and compact, turns on quickly and really takes great outdoor-daytime pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Best
Reviews.Content: Great little camera!!  Pictures are fantasic!  The only kind of picture that I haven't been thrilled with are nighttime pics (but it could be user-error).

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: M. Simms "Michele Simms"
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the camera. For the money I couldn't go wrong. It has made a very nice camera for my teenage daughter.

Reviews.Title: Camera Overheats!
Reviews.Author: Cat Lady
Reviews.Content: I'm pregnant and bought this camera to capture all those special moments.  I used the camera a couple times and it worked pretty well.  I do like some of the different features like to settings for flower pictures, close ups etc.  The video feature worked well too.  However, after less than a week of use, the camera was having LOTS of problems.  As I reviewed the pictures and tried to delete the ones I didn't want, each time it deleted the previous picture!  The screen then showed a message that read something like "DATA NOT FOUND"  The last straw was when I took the camera to my baby shower and it shut off with the shutter open.  I removed the batteries to find that they were so hot I couldn't touch even touch them.  The whole unit was overheating.  Once it cooled down I got it to turn on again but it continued to overheat two more times before I gave up trying to use it.  I need a reliable camera and this is not it.  I will be returning it this week.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Angelika Deno
Reviews.Content: This is a good basic camera.  I bought this for my daughter and she likes the easy-to-use design.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easyshare
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: This easyshare take the best pictures. Ther are clear and the size is perfect to carry with you every where. You can't take a picture if you don't have your easyshare.

Reviews.Title: Koda Easyshare
Reviews.Author: Hilda Calvert "Karen Calvert"
Reviews.Content: the camera did everything I had expected it to and more, picture clarity was great and the extras were a plus

Reviews.Title: Buy At Your Own Risk
Reviews.Author: Rudedawg
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware: The camera is ok but the software is HORRIBLE; NO SUPPORT FROM KODAK!I purchased this camera a year or so ago from elsewhere rather than Amazon but I am trying to let everyone know Buy At Your Own Risk! Save yourself hours on end of grief and purchase any other brand but Kodak. We use Canon's at work and I should have known better but the wife loved the color of this camera and I failed to read all the warning reviews about the terrible software issues. Lesson learned: sometimes you just have to duck and run by saying "no". There is not a star for ZERO or it would have rated it, that is the only reason it gets a 1.

Reviews.Title: decent little camera
Reviews.Author: SoCal Homeowner
Reviews.Content: Takes great pix.  Have used Kodak Easyshare for years.  Only drawback (and I am sure most cameras of this pedigree suffer from this) is that it takes too long to gear up for the next pic.  You have to wait a painful amount of time - while it saves each image - to be able to take the next shot. But, I expect that's the norm on these guys.

Reviews.Title: Used
Reviews.Author: Helen Jackson
Reviews.Content: Initially, I wanted to return this product because you could tell that it was used and dated because it required batteries. This is a gift for an 11 year old.  Decided to keep it as a test with hopes of upgrading to a better camera later. Good first camera for the age group.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about two years and finally bought a new Canon one off Amazon(which arrived today!)the Canon Powershot SX260Hs that has terrific reviews and costs just $199.This Kodak camera was so disappointing on many levels.  I had never had the battery drain problem like so many others did, but the picture quality is awful.  Maybe 1 out 20 pictures I have taken (and there have been hundreds) comes out what you could call good.  The pictures are dark, fuzzy, and grainy no matter what the lighting is or whether it is inside or outside.  Messing with the controls never made a difference.  People's eyes were always red.  I have been embarrassed more than one time to show people my pictures from this camera, they are that bad.I only regret all of the baby pictures of my daughter, and the pictures of my mom before she passed away, were taken with this low budget camera.  I could kick myself for not buying a better one sooner!!!By the way, I already took some pictures with my new Canon- AWESOME clarity, detail and color!  Don't cheap out, and buy this one from Kodak.  There are much better ones out there for your moments that matter.

Reviews.Title: Damaged
Reviews.Author: L. Pel
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research on this camera and finally decided I wanted it.  It didn't work at all. The lens fogged up right away when going outside to take pictures and it wouldn't capture them.  On the plus side, amazon accepted the return right away and I bought the next one up, the C182, which I love!

Reviews.Title: e z to use
Reviews.Author: paul peiffer
Reviews.Content: super little cam. fits in your pocket..takes great shots..no frills ..just great pics ..really glad I have this camera now

Reviews.Title: Used since 2009 no troubles.
Reviews.Author: Cybele A. Baker
Reviews.Content: This is a great inexpensive digital camera I bought mine in 2009 and never had any of the problems anyone else here complains about. I wonder when these problems occur for folks why they do  not contact the manufacturer to make sure it is just not a fault in their specific camera?I have been useing rechargeable batteries for years with this camera and have been able to use the same batteries for ages before they run out of power. Pictures print out very well and the videos are quite good too.This is very basic camera, not a lot of bells and whistles but is perfect for basic digital picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Not my best choice
Reviews.Author: Gayle Wood
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pictures, but you have to change the date every time you use it and the date always prints on the pictures unless you order them from a vendor.  It doesn't transfer to the memory card automatically and so you quickly run out of space.  Not a good one for a IDOT.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth It!
Reviews.Author: A. Gift For You "Chapina"
Reviews.Content: I DO NOT recommend this digital camera. It has poor quality picture and it will eat your batteries fast. Be carefull! You'll be spending more money on batteries than what the camera is worth. I sold mines after a couple of months I bought it. Next time I decide to buy a new digital camera, I will do my research first.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: David A. Craig "adhdreader"
Reviews.Content: Overall, the camera itself is fine.Not impressed that this camera is a 2+ years old model; yet was sold as new; and, as a gift, the original Kodak box showed the 2+ years worth of wear and tear;I bought this for my 71 year old Father, who decided he wanted a Digital Camera, that was simple to operate. I did a few searches and this model popped up several times, thus the reason I bought it.Disappointed to find a newer, better quality Kodak model for $20. cheaper at Wal-Mart; but oh well, you get what you get, when you don't do your homework.Great transaction, nice little camera; although, in 2+ years much better technology has emerged, that this camera is already an antique, before being given as a gift.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C180 10.2MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.4 inch LCD - Red
Reviews.Author: Miguel SR
Reviews.Content: The Kodak EasyShare C180 10.2MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.4 inch LCD - Red  is simply, looks like cheap and use two AA batteries, the pictures are Ok. Is a little overpriced vs features that has. You sould spend some more and get a way better camera. Thank You..

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Helen A. Breitenbach
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a little over a year ago, and should have returned it when I first noticed that some of my pictures were blurry, but I thought I was the cause by shaking the camera.  Since it is not my primary camera I'd forget about the problem till the next time I used the camera.  Now 75% of the pictures are totally distorted and,  while looking at reviews for another camera I came across the expression "barrel distortion".  That seems to describe the problem.  Everyone looks like they are in a house of mirrors.  The time lag between shots is far too long and I plan to throw this camera in the trash.  I doubt Kodak would do anything about my problem  at this point. This camera is not worth $5, much less nearly $100.  Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: not that great
Reviews.Author: shopper girl
Reviews.Content: Batteries dont last.....a little disappointing.  Only option was to take the batteries out and only put them in when taking a picture.  Much happier with the nikon i bought over the summer than this camera.  :-(

Reviews.Title: Cute and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Swann "Elizabeth Turner"
Reviews.Content: My friend owns this camera, and I adore it. Its really easy to use and the pictures turn out really good on it! Granted some pictures in the dark or dim light don't turn out to well example - [...] this picture of last Christmas, but on average, this [...] is how most of them turn out. And that last pic actually had the b&w; feature in use on it.Overall, I love the camera, its great! its even good at capturing motions and such. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants a fun, easy camera to work with.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Dud
Reviews.Author: oldcarman
Reviews.Content: Camera already had to go in for repair....not as durable as their older products, one bump and down it goes for the count!  My third Kodak in a row and I won't make that mistake again....they no longer make film and they can no longer make cameras either from the looks of it.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. Charles "Whoryou?"
Reviews.Content: unimpressive product with poor picture quality...spend a little more and get a coolpix so as not to be upset about poorly captured memories

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED
Reviews.Author: fltraveler
Reviews.Content: Took a couple of pictures with the camera. Everything worked great!After five pictures the camera died. Figured it was that the company stuffed some old batteries.No big deal. Bought brand new batteries. The thing still doesn't turn on! Nada! Zip!Wanted to use it on a roadtrip. Kodak sucks!

Reviews.Title: So easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Claire Demboski
Reviews.Content: I am totally electronically challenged!!  That is why I love this camera, so easy to use, no problems whatever.  Wish the batteries would last longer.  But I bought a battery charger and that problem was solved.  I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Pleasance
Reviews.Content: Camera is fine.  But batteries fail quickly.  Had to replace already.  Pictures are good.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and share pictures
Reviews.Author: C. L. Johnston
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent quality pictures that are easy to share on the internet. My only problem is that the batteries do not last very long.

Reviews.Title: nice camera for price- batteries seem to drain quick
Reviews.Author: Andrew W. Morris "Self Help Geek"
Reviews.Content: the batteries seem to drain quick... but it is kind of nice to be able to just put a bunch of batteries in my brief case and so no matter how long i am out i always have power and just can switch readily available aa batteries.  i am a real estate broker and it slips nice in my black leather business bag.  i have an SLR for nicer listings but i use this more for issues where I am out and about and want to take pictures for a buyer client as we show a house for their memory. or sometimes I will do a valuation. i always have this on me so it is a very handy.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for a teenager
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline
Reviews.Content: I bought this gift for my teenage daughter who is very tough on all electronics. She has dropped, thrown, and abused this camera and it still works. I would purchase this camera again if she ever destroys this one.

Reviews.Title: She is happy
Reviews.Author: Frank Duane Fosco
Reviews.Content: It was a Christmas gift. The recipient was happy with her gift--which made me glad.Thank you,Frank Fosco

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Oatley
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter and she loves it. Its very easy to use and the pictures are great. If you are looking for an inexpensive camera that takes great pictures and is easy to use this ones for you.I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera for my 8-year-old!
Reviews.Author: D. Bayiates "South Knox Girl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my eight-year-old daughter.  It is so easy to use, and the picture quality is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Out of the box bad
Reviews.Author: P Cook
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kodak Easyshare C180 camera as a Christmas gift for my granddaughter and was "out of the box bad". Put the Kodak Alkaline batteries in it that came with the camera, took about three pictures and the batteries were bad. We replaced the batteries with new Duracell Alkaline batteries, took a few more pictures and the new batteries were bad. Tried this a few more times in denial that a brand new Kodak camera would be bad.Contacted Kodak and was instructed to send the camera to their repair center in Conneticut and it could be repaired or be replaced with a refurbished one.  The repair service sent the camera back and it was just as bad as when I sent it.  The repair service told me it was because I used alkaline batteries and I should buy rechargeable batteries and a charger.  Why would Kodak send the camera with alkaline batteries if they didn't work?  Kodak's website indicated if you use alkaline batteries you should get between 30-70 pictures, and of course we got no where near that, maybe 5 at the most.  Even if the camera was not in use, it was draining the batteries.  It is obvious that the camera is drawing more current than the batteries can hold.  The repair center told me to basically live with the problem.  After indicating the world was going to come to an end for their reputation by way of the internet, they called back to say they would send me rechargeable batteries and a charger and if that didn't work, to call them back.  I most likely will be calling back.So I have paid for brand new batteries that lasted no more than five minutes to test the camera, UPS charges to return the camera and am no closer to solving the problem.Today I am going out to buy a Sony camera because I think my graddaughter has waited long enough for her Christmas gift.  I would strongly suggest anyone considering buying this camera to reconsider.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Picture Quality!!
Reviews.Author: L. Pauling
Reviews.Content: This camera takes terrible pictures!!! I purchased it because I make the school's yearbook, and it's useless! If I use the "auto" setting to get enough light in the pictures, the people are grainy or blurry. If I use the "action" setting to reduce the blur, then the pictures are underexposed. In some situations, these amorphous white dots of light just appear in the pictures.I have tried every setting available and nothing helps. I have missed so many cute shots that would have been wonderful and cannot be reproduced this year.Having bought a Kodak Easyshare C model years ago, which took AMAZING pictures and just flat wore out, I thought this one would do the same...big mistake. Do NOT buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Santa Clause gives me Junk
Reviews.Author: anteKA
Reviews.Content: Santa gave one each to my two girls 8 & 10, and they were just right for them.  We got LOTS of RedEye in their pix.  I thought that was eliminated long ago back in the twentieth century; what gives?  So one camera still works fine, the other only has a dark screen no matter what I do... It's dead, dead, dead.  My eight year old is very confused; Hey Kodak, what should I tell her?  This is one of my first Bad reviews, the other is for the Kodak K4500 battery charger, which quickly quit working.

Reviews.Title: Great portable camera
Reviews.Author: H. Kuch
Reviews.Content: This is a great portable (cheap) camera.  I carry this one in my purse to snap pictures of my toddler in random moments.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easy share
Reviews.Author: Tex-Roy
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my new Kodak easy share it is easy to use, portable and with sharing pictures made easy. This is what I expect from a Kodak product. I will recommend the Kodak easy share with a battery life that is good and rechargeable.

Reviews.Title: A good and easy camera
Reviews.Author: J. Baltrus "Balthazar"
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about this camera if you buy sight unseen (in person) is that it is thicker than I would prefer.  Nonetheless, it is still very portable. light, is quick, takes very nice photos, and is intuitive. Digital cameras have come a long way and the fact there many 10MP cameras out well under $100 is awesome.  I have a Canon Rebel Xti and no a camera like this C180 will compare but I don't think any point and shoot will.  I have also owned 2 Canon point and shoots - both had the LCD die over time.  I also had a Nikon Coolpix, and it was way too slow which caused poor picture quality as well, hence soon sold it.  So these little Kodaks I think are well worth it when compared to the other major brands.  If you want a thinner camera, I suggest the M340, I would of paid the extra $15 for that.One odd but good thing, photos shot at full resolution 3664 x 2748 come in at only 1.6mb whereas my Canon Rebel (also 10mp) shoots 2592 x 3888 but each photo is much bigger = 3.8mb.The HD photos on this C180 are a misnomer.  They are actually wide angle, panoramic photos which can only be shot at 7.6 megapixels - which is fine but not what is advertised.It has video, but buy a video camera if you want to shoot videos.  I don't know about the Kodak EasyShare software, it is not a selling point for me since Picasa has been around.

Reviews.Title: great product!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca L. Lynch
Reviews.Content: This camera came in a timely fashion as promised.  Its cute and easy to use , good photos.  Will use this vendor again.  thanks!

Reviews.Title: do not waste ur money
Reviews.Author: candmakr
Reviews.Content: do not waste ur money this should just be in the garbage. aside from its eating batteries the on and off switch make it unusable. I wish I could return it bec its only useful as a paperweight and has taken a total of five pictures and kaput!

Reviews.Title: Best Little Camera
Reviews.Author: aldunlap
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I get great pictures and it is so simply to use. The only draw back is the batteries does not last long. I purchased a battery charger to solve that problem. Other than that its a great camera for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Review of Kodak EasyShare C180 Digital Camera (Blue)
Reviews.Author: J. La Dage
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera for the price. I have had more expensive digital cameras, but I found that you paid for a whole bunch of features that you never used. This is a what most people need; a straight forward point and shoot. I like not having to rely on finding an outlet to recharge (uses batteries) and the button that is available to select flash or not is really a plus. Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera Review
Reviews.Author: D. J. Zutter
Reviews.Content: The Camera has met my expectations. I wanted a camera that gave good quality pyctures but was not expensive. This Camera fits the requirements. Hopefully it will continue to operate properly in the days ahead.

Reviews.Title: digital camera, point and shoot, kodak easyshare c182, photography, kodak easyshare, point, shoot digital cameras, polaroid digi
Reviews.Author: Catherine M. Nagy "Campogarcia"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a  refurbished camera for my grand daughter.  I was very happy with the quality and speed it was received.  the wrong transfer cable was in the box and I made one e-mail and it was resent immediately!  great service

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera
Reviews.Author: Desiree Marcy "Shopping expert!"
Reviews.Content: This is an ok camera. About as decent a they get for kodak. Takes nice pictures and I am happy with the quality and for the money I paid. Seems to have held up well so far. All kodak cameras suck batteries down.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy share camera C180
Reviews.Author: jdickerh "jdickerh"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my Dad.  Not the greatest qualitybut good enough for what he needs. For the price it wasworth it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Michael D. White
Reviews.Content: Bought so she could send me pictures. It's easy for her to use and the pics I get in E mails are gr8.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C180
Reviews.Author: Robin B. Morrill
Reviews.Content: I bought one for my 8 year old daughter.  She loved it and used it even without reading the directions.  I loved it so much I bought one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Dian
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my Niece and she was very happy to receive it. Quick shipping and in great condition.

Reviews.Title: he love the camera
Reviews.Author: wanda faison "donnie98"
Reviews.Content: my nephew love this camera it was the best xmas gift everthankswanda

Reviews.Title: Bought for the kids
Reviews.Author: Mom of 4 "Melissa"
Reviews.Content: I got 3 cameras same model different colors for my kids,: 17, 13, & 12. They all seem to enjoy these cameras, only complaint is that while it can record video there is no microphone/sound.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the $
Reviews.Author: Gisselle Baez
Reviews.Content: It's Great !!I Recomend you get rechargeable.Pic. Quality Good.Very Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: overall a great product
Reviews.Author: Zoraida Maza Guevara
Reviews.Content: it's an excelent camera but it doesnt show the sqares when doing face detection and I would like a smile shot. besides it a great camera, also I would like it to have a rechargeable batery.

Reviews.Title: kodak easy share C180 10 MP
Reviews.Author: Raymond L. McMahon "rainman"
Reviews.Content: this is a great buy,I also purchased the 4 GB memory chip as a package deal as a gift for my wife.

Reviews.Title: kodak does it best
Reviews.Author: Lisa Davis "marshmello"
Reviews.Content: the name says it all trust the industry leader for best results also get their low ink printer

Reviews.Title: DO NOT ignore bad review's
Reviews.Author: Davit Hayrapetyan "David"
Reviews.Content: I ignored all the bad review's and bought this camera. Once i received the package, i went to the mall to take pix. This camera only took 5 pix, and already the battery was dead, and the memory was full. I tried to install the software to my laptop, threw the cameras usb, that did not work eater. People say the picture  quality is worth the price, i totally disagree with that. By adding only $10-20 you can get a way better quality with the Samsung sl 202. I returned this kodak, and got that instead. It is 100 times better!!!  Here is the link. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001TUZ6MM/ref=oss_product

Reviews.Title: do not buy this!!
Reviews.Author: POPZU1
Reviews.Content: Had it for about a month & then it just stop turning on? Tried new batterys' & still nothing. So i spent like 100 bucks for nothing!! This camera blow's!!!

Reviews.Title: Not Mac compatible
Reviews.Author: Huxley
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare isn't compatible with the most recent Mac OS (10.4.x). If you have an Apple, don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: The batteris dies after five pictures.
Reviews.Author: Simba
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my niece a month ago. After using it for a first time, we found that after 5-6 pictures the batteries have to be changed. It's not the batteries, just the camera is bad.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C180...Video Capable Camera w/NO SOUND
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Throckmorton
Reviews.Content: Purchased this 6/24/10 for USD $79.00 from local Office Depot. Intend to return it. Why, you may ask? Well, consider that this video-capable camera contains NO SPEAKER. So, if you buy it for someone who enjoys shooting short videos, be aware that  they will NOT be able to hear any sound when they play them back. Quoth the Kodak website:"NOTE: Sound cannot be played on the camera. Sound is heard after the video is transferred to your computer."That's a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: software problems
Reviews.Author: Jeff W "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use as a carry around and lend to a friend as needed.  That was a mistake.  The Kodak software is not that great and it does not work well with Picasa or other programs.  There are apparently fixes which I have not gotten to work yet, but who wants to spend the time doing that rather than working on the photos and enjoying them.

Reviews.Title: faulty from date of purchase
Reviews.Author: the juandog
Reviews.Content: This camera I had purchased for my mother hoping she would have fond memories of her Mother's day weekend. From what I had found out, it only took four (4) pictures and then the batteries died. We assumed the obvious, the batteries were no good so we purchased a new set and inserted them into the camera. Lo and behold the same thing occurred, in my opinion this camera sucks for being a Kodak but we did get what we paid for. If you want a good camera stick with Nikon or Canon.

Reviews.Title: thumbs up
Reviews.Author: S. Ingles "S. Ingles, "cheaper textbooks&...
Reviews.Content: Just got it, had to get used to setting up the software, am still getting used to the camera, but it's fine for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Stacey Thompson "STACEY THOMPSON"
Reviews.Content: WE BOUGHT THIS FOR ARE DAUGHTER AND IT IS A GREAT CAMERA.WE HAVE THOUGHT ABOUT GETTING ONE FOR FAMILY PHOTO'S.

Reviews.Title: More Of A Review Of The Reviews
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Church "P/A lover 4ever!"
Reviews.Content: Buying a digital camera is quite hard I'm finding out. I've used one in the past that was a canon I believe and it got a lens error very quickly. Well my mom was going to get me another one as a late b-day present and I came across this one which not only has a great color but is supposed to have high res photos, do video clips AND shoots black and white which are very big turn on's for me. Not that I hate shooting color because I don't.The problem is the more I read reviews, the more I'm questioning why so many of them gave this a 3 or 4 star rating when their reviews said it sucked. For ppl like me who just want to take a clear photo and will never end up being professional photographers, the 3 and 4 start reviews on a camera they think is crap is very confusing for those of us are searching and searching for a good one who look at these review stars and think it is when it's not.So if anything I just want to let ppl know that if you don't like your camera, please give it the 1 star review so more ppl know to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Hanley "Cherry Berry"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my 12 years old son, He likes it. He hasn't printed any pictures yet. Would recommend it. Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I cannot believe this camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew G. Geankoplis
Reviews.Content: After 2 days the camera just entirely stopped working. I've tried everyting, nothing works. I googled it, other people have had the same problem. Just completely stops functioning after a couple days. What a piece of garbage. What an awful company.I'm going to return it now. Thanks Kodak. The last time I'll ever be stupid enough to buy one of your products.

Reviews.Title: ok camera...
Reviews.Author: ncvs purchases
Reviews.Content: hate that i cant just read the SD card with my SD reader.  what kind of stupid format cant be read these days...

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera review
Reviews.Author: Karen A. Stevens
Reviews.Content: I like everything about the camera except the lack of a manuel.  I have no idea how to use most of the things on the camera and find it very frustrating.  Wish there would have been a decent owner's manual with it.  :-(

Reviews.Title: Question
Reviews.Author: MEdouble D "Good Book Lover"
Reviews.Content: I should have read all the reviews and info before purchasing.  My question is 'is it possible to upload to my computer without going to online and you tube?'  I don't care to share online and you tube just to my family and friends through e-mail. You probably can tell I know nothing about cameras,just wanted something better than my cell phone camera  I like this already and really don't want to get rid of it, but I'm not interested in sharing online.  Please help me.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: WTL
Reviews.Content: It's an ok camera except you can't playback stuff videotaped because there's no speaker for sound so you can't hear anything.  Also, you have to use batteries which can be a pain sometimes.

Reviews.Title: Should have been coloredyellow...I got a Lemon.
Reviews.Author: Peterack
Reviews.Content: My camera came in time for Christmas and was the worst piece of equipment I have ever recieved.  It would only take and store two pics...quality bad...,it would not save backups to the disk and the fully charged battery kept running out after 5 minutes.  It seems I got the only lemon of these; I've sent it back to amazon for my refund and will buy another camera at a reputable dealer.

Reviews.Title: Chuck it & get a Canon
Reviews.Author: jack crossfire
Reviews.Content: For this amount of money, you can get a Canon with much better quality.  The Kodaks have light leaks so when pointed perpendicular to the sun, you get red blobs.  The Kodaks shoot 640x240 & upscale it.  There's no manual control of anything.  Picture quality sux.  Video encoding sux.  Red blobs suck.

Reviews.Title: No memory
Reviews.Author: R. A. Farver "crabbup"
Reviews.Content: I took 6 photos, and got the "memory full" signal.  Also, the viewfinder was not a good indicator of what the picture would be.  My granddaughter says it is "clunky" for what it does (not much), and it should have a battery charger.  On "ease of use", I would give it a 1 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: No Card, No instructions booklet, very very low internal memory
Reviews.Author: Mary B. Snyder "Hachita"
Reviews.Content: No Card, No instructions booklet, very very low internal memory.  I bought it, took it to an even, and could not use it.  Seller did not offer a card to me.  Even my cheapie HP and Take-It digital cameras came with cards.I returned the item.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.2-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
Kodak AF 3x optical aspheric zoom lens (35 mm equivalent: 32 - 96 mm)
Capture beautiful HD pictures in 16:9 format; view in high definition on an HDTV or other HD device
2.4-inch LCD screen; Face Detection, Blur Reduction features
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare C180 Digital Camera (Blue)
